title: A Wobbly Black Hole Jet Affects a Galaxy
summary: In space, some galaxies have a super bright center called an active galactic nucleus, powered by a supermassive black hole. This black hole pulls in gas and dust, releasing energy that can create jets shooting out from the galaxy. Astronomers led by Justin Kader studied a nearby galaxy named VV 340a and found that its black hole jet is wobbling like a spinning top. This wobbling jet pushes gas out of the galaxy at a fast rate, about 19 suns' worth of mass each year. When gas is pushed out, it can't be used to make new stars, so this affects how many stars the galaxy can form in the future. The scientists used telescopes like the James Webb Space Telescope to see through dust and observe this process, helping us understand how black holes change galaxies over time.

keywords.explanation: a space object with strong gravity that pulls in things like gas
a stream of energy shooting out from a black hole
a huge group of stars, gas, and dust in space
material in space that can form stars
bright balls of gas in space that shine

questions.question: What is the bright center of some galaxies called?
Who led the astronomers in studying VV 340a?
How does the jet from the black hole move?
What does the jet push out of the galaxy?
How much gas is pushed out each year in sun masses?
Why is pushing gas out bad for star formation?
options: Gas is needed to make stars
questions.correct_answer: Gas is needed to make stars

background_read: Galaxies are huge collections of stars, gas, and dust held together by gravity. Black holes are invisible objects with very strong gravity that can pull in nearby material. When a black hole is active, it can create jets of energy that affect the galaxy around it. Astronomers use telescopes to study these processes and learn how galaxies change over billions of years.
Article_Structure: WHO: Astronomers led by Justin Kader
WHAT: Observed a wobbling black hole jet pushing gas out of galaxy VV 340a
WHERE: In a nearby galaxy called VV 340a
WHY: To understand how black holes affect star formation in galaxies

perspectives.description: Shows how black hole jets can change galaxies by removing gas needed for stars
